intro: Heterodendrum tropicum, commonly known as the tropical heterodendrum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
